beginLogout(bytes32).details: Indexing node can start logout process

params._subgraphId: <bytes32> - Subgraph ID the Indexing Node has staked Graph Tokens for

params._governor: <address> - Address of the multisig contract as Governor of this contract
params._token: <address> - Address of the Graph Protocol token

curatorLogout(bytes32,uint256).details: Return any amount of shares to get tokens back (above the minimum)

params._subgraphId: <bytes32> - Subgraph ID the Curator is returning shares for

finalizeLogout(bytes32).details: Indexing node can finish the logout process after a thawing off period

params._subgraphId: <bytes32> - Subgraph ID the Indexing Node has staked Graph Tokens for

getRewardForValue(uint256).details: Get the amount of fisherman reward for a given amount of stake
getRewardForValue(uint256).return: <uint256> - Percentage of validator's stake to be considered a reward

numberOfGraphIndexingNodeAddresses().details: Get the number of graph indexing nodes in the dynamic array

rejectDispute(bytes32).details: The arbitrator can reject a dispute as being invalid.

params._disputeId: <bytes32> - ID of the dispute to be rejected

params._arbitrator: <address> - The address of the arbitration contract or party

params._newIndexers: <Array<address>> - Array of new indexers that have coordinated outside       of the protocol, and pre-index the new subgraph before the switch happens
params._subgraphID: <bytes32> - The subgraph ID of the bootstrapping subgraph ID

setMaximumIndexers(uint256).details: Set the maximum number of Indexing Nodes

params._maximumIndexers: <uint256> - Maximum number of Indexing Nodes allowed

setMinimumCurationStakingAmount(uint256).details: Set the Minimum Staking Amount for Market Curators

params._minimumCurationStakingAmount: <uint256> - Minimum amount allowed to be staked for Curation

setMinimumIndexingStakingAmount(uint256).details: Set the Minimum Staking Amount for Indexing Nodes

params._minimumIndexingStakingAmount: <uint256> - Minimum amount allowed to be staked for Indexing Nodes

sharesToStake(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Calculate number of tokens that should be returned for the proportion     of _returnedShares to _currentShares, along the given bonding curve

params._currentShares: <uint256> - Total amount of current shares issued
params._currentTokens: <uint256> - Total amount of tokens currently in reserves
params._reserveRatio: <uint256> - Desired reserve ratio to maintain (in PPM)

sharesToStake(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.return: refundTokens <uint256> - Amount of tokens to return given the above

params._data: <bytes> - Data to parse and handle registration functions

stakeToShares(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.details: Calculate number of shares that should be issued in return for     staking of _purchaseAmount of tokens, along the given bonding curve

params._currentShares: <uint256> - Total amount of current shares issued
params._currentTokens: <uint256> - Total amount of tokens currently in reserves
params._purchaseTokens: <uint256> - Amount of tokens being staked (purchase amount)
params._reserveRatio: <uint256> - Desired reserve ratio to maintain (in PPM)

stakeToShares(uint256,uint256,uint256,ui.return: issuedShares <uint256> - Amount of additional shares issued given the above

transferGovernance(address).details: The current `governor` can assign a new `governor`

unlockFees(bytes32).details: The Indexing Node can get all of their accrued fees for a subgraph at once.     Indexing Node would be able to log out all the fees they earned during a dispute.

params._subgraphId: <bytes32> - Subgraph the Indexing Node wishes to withdraw for.

updateDefaultReserveRatio(uint256).details: Set the percent that the default reserve ratio is for new subgraphs

updateSlashingPercentage(uint256).details: Set the percent that the fisherman gets when slashing occurs

updateThawingPeriod(uint256).details: Set the thawing period for indexer logout

params._thawingPeriod: <uint256> - Number of seconds for thawing period

verifyDispute(bytes32).details: The arbitrator can verify a dispute as being valid.

params._disputeId: <bytes32> - ID of the dispute to be verified
